Pikir Ulang Penyelamatan Jiwasraya
01 Nov 2019 by Ali Umar
MENTERI Badan Usaha Milik Negara Erick Thohir semestinya menghitung kembali skema penyelamatan PT Asuransi Jiwasraya (Persero) yang dirancang pendahulunya. Di zaman Rini Soemarno, empat perusahaan negara diminta patungan memodali PT Jiwasraya Putra, anak perusahaan pelat merah yang gagal bayar utang Rp 802 miliar pada Oktober 2018 itu.
Memaksakan badan usaha lain menanggung risiko kerugian suatu perusahaan merupakan praktik ekonomi tak sehat. Prahara Jiwasraya disebabkan oleh kesalahan manajemen menempatkan investasi atas polis bancassurance-nya, JS Proteksi Plan. Dalam hal ini, tidak sepatutnya negara menanggung kekeliruan suatu lembaga keuangan. Berbeda dengan bank, perusahaan asuransi tak memiliki lembaga penjamin simpanan. Skema penyelamatan untuk Jiwasraya akan menjadi preseden buruk bahwa kerugian lembaga keuangan mana pun akan ditanggung pemerintah.
Kalaupun berhasil, skema pembentukan anak usaha ini diperkirakan baru dapat membantu restrukturisasi keuangan Jiwasraya dalam 5-10 tahun, setelah anak perusahaan itu dijual ke investor. Masalahnya, seberapa kuat PT Bank Tabungan Negara Tbk, PT Kereta Api Indonesia, PT Pegadaian, dan PT Telekomunikasi Selular menanggung risiko gagal bayar Jiwasraya yang disebut mencapai Rp 16 triliun itu? Penyelamatan institusi keuangan oleh lembaga lain hanya bisa dilakukan jika lembaga penolong betul-betul kuat. Jika tidak, justru lembaga penyelamat yang terseret ke jurang kerugian.
Bagaimanapun, masalah di Jiwasraya perlu segera dibereskan. Apalagi wajah bopeng asuransi jiwa di Indonesia pun menjadi perhatian internasional. Bank Dunia juga menyoroti problem keuangan Asuransi Jiwa Bersama Bumiputera, yang harus segera pula diselesaikan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan. Kesulitan keuangan Bumiputera yang berujung pada kegagalan membayar klaim tidak menunjukkan perkembangan berarti selama tiga tahun.
Meski demikian, penyelesaian masalah Jiwasraya perlu dilakukan dengan cara yang tepat. Wacana penyuntikan modal dari pemerintah yang sempat digagas pun merupakan pilihan lebih buruk. Dengan kesulitan likuiditas dan utang jatuh tempo, Jiwasraya hampir pasti menggunakan dana segar suntikan pemerintah tersebut untuk membayar utang. Ujung-ujungnya, modal tersebut ambyar dan negara bisa merugi.
Kementerian BUMN sebagai kuasa pemegang saham bisa melakukan audit investigasi Jiwasraya bersama Otoritas Jasa Keuangan. Audit ini bisa menelusuri temuan Badan Pemeriksa Keuangan, yang pada 2016 mendeteksi investasi tak wajar, yakni pembelian saham PT Trikomsel Oke Rp 449,5 miliar, PT Sugih Energy Rp 318,1 miliar, dan PT Eureka Prima Jakarta Rp 118 miliar. BPK menilai transaksi itu kurang cermat karena lemahnya fundamen perusahaan-perusahaan tersebut. Hingga kini, belum ada seorang pun yang dinyatakan bersalah. Kelalaian OJK, sebagai pengawas pasar modal dan asuransi, ikut berkontribusi dalam kasus ini.
Masih ada jalan untuk meredakan gonjang-ganjing Jiwasraya. Misalnya mencairkan aset finansial. Berdasarkan laporan keuangan terakhir, 2017-laporan keuangan 2018 belum disampaikan-perusahaan ini memiliki reksa dana senilai Rp 19,2 triliun, saham Rp 6,6 triliun, deposito berjangka Rp 4,3 triliun, surat utang negara Rp 3,1 triliun, dan obligasi korporasi Rp 1,8 triliun. Ada juga aset berupa properti senilai Rp 6,6 triliun, di antaranya pusat belanja Cilandak Town Square di Jakarta Selatan. Mencairkan aset tersebut dapat memulihkan kepercayaan nasabah Jiwasraya.
Penyakit di Jiwasraya, juga Bumiputera, telah menurunkan kepercayaan publik terhadap asuransi. Pada awal kepemimpinannya di Kementerian BUMN, Erick Thohir perlu mengambil langkah yang tepat. Kepercayaan publik terhadap asuransi harus dipulihkan. Sebab, modal utama asuransi adalah kepercayaan.

Rethink Jiwasraya Rescue
Nov 1 2019 by Ali Umar
THE MINISTER OF STATE-OWNED ENTERPRISES Erick Thohir should recalculate the rescue scheme of PT Asuransi Jiwasraya (Persero) designed by its predecessor. In the days of Rini Soemarno, four state-owned companies were asked for a joint venture to capitalize on PT Jiwasraya Putra, a state-owned subsidiary that failed to pay Rp 802 billion in debt in October 2018.
Forcing other businesses to risk the loss of a company is an unhealthy economic practice. Prahara Jiwasraya was caused by a mismanagement in placing investment in its bancassurance policy, JS Protection Plan. In this case, the country should not bear the mistake of a financial institution. Unlike banks, insurance companies do not have deposit insurance institutions. The rescue scheme for Jiwasraya will set a bad precedent that the loss of any financial institution will be borne by the government.
Even if it is successful, the scheme to form a subsidiary is estimated to only be able to help Jiwasraya's financial restructuring within 5-10 years, after the subsidiary is sold to investors. The problem is, how strong is PT Bank Tabungan Negara Tbk, PT Kereta Api Indonesia, PT Pegadaian, and PT Telekomunikasi Selular bears the risk of Jiwasraya's failure to reach Rp 16 trillion? Rescuing financial institutions by other institutions can only be done if the supporting institutions are truly strong. If not, it is the rescue agency that is dragged to the brink of loss.
However, problems in Jiwasraya need to be resolved immediately. Moreover, the face of pockmarked life insurance in Indonesia has become an international concern. The World Bank also highlights the financial problems of the Bumiputera Joint Life Insurance, which must be resolved immediately by the Financial Services Authority. Bumiputera's financial difficulties which led to failure to pay claims did not show any significant progress for three years.
However, the solution to the Jiwasraya problem needs to be done in the right way. The idea of capital injection from the government that was initiated was even a worse choice. With liquidity and debt maturity difficulties, Jiwasraya is almost certain to use the government's fresh injection funds to pay off debt. In the end, the capital is lost and the country can suffer losses.
The SOE Ministry as the shareholder's authority can conduct an investigation audit of Jiwasraya together with the Financial Services Authority. This audit can trace the findings of the Supreme Audit Agency, which in 2016 detected an unreasonable investment, namely the purchase of PT Trikomsel Okay shares at Rp 449.5 billion, PT Sugih Energy at Rp 318.1 billion, and PT Eureka Prima Jakarta at Rp 118 billion. The BPK considered the transaction to be inaccurate due to the weak fundamentals of these companies. Until now, no one has been found guilty. OJK's negligence, as a supervisor of capital markets and insurance, also contributed to the case.
There is still a way to calm Jiwasraya's turmoil. For example, withdrawing financial assets. Based on the latest financial statements, 2017-2018 financial statements have not been submitted-this company has a mutual fund valued at Rp 19.2 trillion, shares of Rp 6.6 trillion, time deposits of Rp 4.3 trillion, state debt of Rp 3.1 trillion, and IDR 1.8 trillion corporate bonds. There are also assets in the form of property valued at Rp 6.6 trillion, including the Cilandak Town Square shopping center in South Jakarta. Disbursing these assets can restore the confidence of Jiwasraya customers.
Disease in Jiwasraya, also Bumiputera, has reduced public confidence in insurance. At the beginning of his leadership at the Ministry of SOEs, Erick Thohir needs to take the right steps. Public trust in insurance must be restored. Therefore, the main capital of insurance is trust.
Note:
This is a magazine article on the 28 October-03 November 2019 edition
